formattedAddress: 111 N State St (at E Randolph St)

items.summary: Lots of people like this place

items.text: It is Marshall Fields, not Macys.
This is THE place to be around Christmas. The tree in the room is SPLENDID!
If you want to fully enjoy The Walnut Room...the go on a weeknight for dinner. Sat right next to the tree and had no wait for a table.
complimentary limited edition Christmas mug with a specialty drink!
Get there early for the best seats by the tree! Such a wonderful place to begin a family tradition.
Sip on the recommended Beverages and get a 2013 limited edition holiday mug while supplies last.
Plan ahead. 4+ hour wait to eat
Get the chicken pot pie, and enjoy 1/2 price bottles of wine on Wednesday
Blt Burger!
The food was awesome to eat the service was great and fast . If you do get Chicago you should go there and eat ..
Delicious walnut salad!
Fantastic pot pie! Best I have ever had!
Get the chicken pot pie, duh!
Amé el árbol navideño y el pastel de carne el mejor que he probado 😉
The cheese plate isn't anything too special, but it's pretty good.
Not a lot has changed in this room since the hostile takeover. Still a great place for a midday break
Fantastic meal -- great food, great atmosphere at almost criminally low prices. Frango mint cheesecake is wonderful!
So beautiful at Christmas.
Swen!  Great waiter! And of course a must is the pot pie.
Kitchen closes at 8, which is a problem for an after work dinner. The pot pie is really good. Half off bottles of wine on Wednesdays.

sample.text: ... of the city. Their chicken pot pie is perfection.
... on the couches. The Marshall field's staff is wonderfully tolerant of...

formattedAddress: 71 W Monroe St (btwn Dearborn St & Clark St)

items.summary: Lots of people like this place

venue.description: Three restaurants in one: The Village, La Cantina, and Vivere.

items.text: You'll feel like you have walked on the set of the Soprano's good food.
Good chicken parmigiana here. Serves two if you are not too hungry.
I loved this place! Great pasta! 👏👏👍👍⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
O mais antigo restaurante Italiano em Chicago, IL
Go upstairs. Sit in the bar with Vinnie. Watch. Tip well
Try the seafood ravioli. Delish.
Lasagna. That's it. Have the lasagna.
The black truffle gnocchi appetizer is amazing.
delicious! customer service is off the chart. I went to the upper restaurant, great old Italy feel. I heard the restaurants on the main and lower floor are just as yummy..
Great date spot, lasagna was real filling and their pizza feeds 2.
Wait time was short, service was great and spaghetti and meatballs was filling, authentic and yummy. I'd call it a win by all accounts.
Mind blowing dishes, fantastic decorations, terrific personnel!  Get the sea bass or NY steak, and you won't regret it!
The food is to die for. If I lived in Chicago, I would be a regular. Try and sit at one of the booths when you visit. Lovely decor
3cheese ravioli awesome.. :-p
The baked mostaccioli  with spicy arrabbiata sauce and meatballs is usually why I come to Chicago.
They CONSTANTLY fill your water glass! Come thirsty :)
With three different restaurants to serve you, you should always be able to find a table. Personal favorite: Linguine con frutti di mare! Valet parking is available. Catching a show nearby? Eat here!
There is nothing that isn't amazing about this restaurant. Love the culture, atmosphere, service, and exquisite food. It's my family's favorite restaurant in the entire city.
When you don't know what you want, this is what you want.
Ambiance & Food

items.name: The Most Family-Friendly Spots in Chicago
items.description: Pack the stroller and head to the city! Whether you have a family of eight or you're just a kid at heart, here's our list of the most family-friendly places in Chicago.

sample.text: The lasagna and the spaghetti with meat sauce are...
... this place! You must eat upstairs feels like a summer day in Italy! The...
... Highly recommend their seafood ravioli and the lasagna!

items.summary: Lots of people like this place

items.text: Thought you'd want to know: Chicago Cut has been nominated for Best New Steakhouse in Time Out Chicago’s 2011 Eat Out Awards. Vote now!
Just going for a drink? Head to the terrace.
Chicago Cut brings big steaks, chops and seafood, cooked impeccably by chef Jackie Shen. Add in great cocktails and a bustling room and this spot is a winner. [Eater 38 Member]
If you’re looking for an alfresco steakhouse experience, it’s tough to beat a seat on Chicago Cut's expansive patio. http://tmout.us/maA24
Need a power breakfast to kick-start the day? Come here for their insanely thick Breakfast Sandwich or incredible New York Strip & Eggs. And do NOT skip the hash browns.
Lobster and black truffle risotto?! It's completely worth it.
Amazing service!
IPad wine list is great fun for those who like to see what they are ordering
The majority - who at our company lunch outing ordered marbled filets 'medium', had them come out closer to well done. Maybe they were 'off' because of the lunch rush. We'll give them another shot.
Along the Chicago River looking east.  The seating is a bit tight at tables, booths are spacious.  Great drink & wine selection via iPad app.  Steaks & sides are great!  Go! (4 of 4 petals via Fondu)
The only place I will ever eat beef and splurge on the good wine (with help from the iPad app). Must try!
The thick breakfast sandwich, layered with scrambled eggs, bacon, white cheddar, tomatoes and arugula pesto, is excellent. Seasoned hash browns, broiled tomato and asparagus spears balance the plate.
WOW!  Where do I begin:  outdoor seating, in-house aged steaks, truffle scalloped potatoes, top-notch service by Stephen (request him!!!) What more can be said for a fabulous dining experience???
Excellent cuts of meat
Always PERFECT!
great place and view at the river
Steak. Any of them but I always get the smallest filet. Add the truffle scalloped potatoes if you want to indulge. Great outdoor seating on the river with heat lamps so you can enjoy into the Fall.
Absolutely amazing!! Great service! Arturito is the best bartender! Amazing view on the terrace !! Highly recommended !!
The star at this sleek power hub is the prime Bone-In Ribeye. Dry-aged 35 days and butchered onsite, the rich, slightly mineral-flavored cut arrives at your table with the perfect caramelized crust.
At the door, an autographed Patrick Kane jersey on the dog. That's how we Buffalonians do #welcoming

items.text: Not ordering dessert here is like going to Paris and not having a croissant. Must order: Thoughts on a Peanut Butter Cup.

items.text: Get the Half & Half!
Neighborhood joint with incredible desserts.  Don't pass up the savory dishes though! -Rick Bayless, Top Chef
Try the Hot Chocolate
We recommend the salads (egg and tuna, both richer and more delicious than any version you’ve had), but only if you start with the incomparable brunch breads—a selection of coffee cake, croissants.
You’ll love the scoops of salted caramel so much, you’ll want to marry it.
Split one mug of hot chocolate, it's so rich and creamy you won't be able to finish one on your own! And desserts are super tiny just enough to share for two
Crabcake burger with some pumpkik beer to wash it down was delicious as well as the mint chocolate ice cream for dessert.
Where to begin? The desserts are stunning, but don't forget the savory side of the menu. Of course, you could also just get a cup of the restaurant's namesake dish.
Yummy and delicious
Try the medium iced chocolate with homemade marshmallows. Yummmm
Lunch ends at 2pm.   Pretty early don't ya think?
Get the Study: a five part dessert that revolves around a seasonal ingredient:
GO HERE, do not delay Chicagoans, warm up with tasty treats and a large variety of hot chocolates.
Dedicated to supporting local farmers and growers, Hot Chocolate works with such producers as Adrian Plapp, Green Acres Farm, Nichols Farm and Mick Klug Farm.
EAT HERE!!

items.summary: Lots of people like this place

items.text: Greek Island is the staple of Greek Town, importing wines, olives oil, oregano, honey and olives straight from Greece. Try their distinctive lima beans and Colorado lamb.
The whole staff is great. Tons of great options. Some favorites: saganaki, Athenian salad, broiled salmon, Lake Superior white fish tail, gyros (extra tzatziki). Hot Lima beans may be the star.
Taramasalata!  Opa!
Wonderful service and amazing food! I've never had lamb before and it was a great first impression. 5 stars!
Get the saganaki cheese!
Agree with everyone else on the flaming saganaki. I ate an ungodly amount of food for a reasonable price
The family platter is insane!!  A must!  Service is great.
Omfg amazing, the food, the service, the venue, the staff, this is one of the best resturants I've ever been to period!
Seemed like the mixed drinks were watered down.
Tourists and locals alike pack the house every night to try everything from fried zucchini with skordalia (garlic-potato dip) and dolmades (stuffed grape leaves) to roast lamb and fresh red snapper.
You must try the Kolokithakia, it's incredible!
It's almost like if you were in Greece. Try to taste everything you can. Authentic.
Seafood especially grilled octopus and appetizers
Jimmy Bannos Sr., chef of Heaven on Seven, eats here on his nights off. He loves the Whole roasted fish.
Try the family meal for two!!! Omg! So much food, and it is delicious.   This is the best Greek Restaurant ever!!!!
Very attentive service. Great and plentiful food that's worth the not-expensive prices. Lots of seating. And you will almost never have less than half a glass at a given moment.
Fantastic Saganaki and two course pairings. Opa!
Portions are gigantic, so the last time I was there I just ordered a plate of squid for starters and it was a full meal.
Skip the table and eat at the bar.
Excellent service, valet. Delectable salmon.

items.text: Food was delish but wine list is over priced for a Bbq joint
The Pulled Pork sandwich is delectable and "The Q" uses the PERFECT bun. Try it with the South Carolina Mustard sauce; I couldn't get enough. Is this the best Pulled Pork in Chicago? It might be.
They have bottomless mimosas here. I WILL be back for brunch. Oh, and the brisket sandwich is amazing but the baby back ribs are life changing.
Get some meat.
Try the Competition St. Louis slab from our 100 Best list: These ribs take two additional hours of labor because they’re pulled out of the smoker periodically to baste. These bones are killing it.
Finally found one item on menu that was horrible. The garlic shrimp on grilled polenta. Weird overly spiced (pepper-y in an unpleasant way). Only item I don't recommend
DON'T order the $3.00 soda.  It's a MINI coke bottle with no refills!
@chicagoqBBq Omg, Dan is a great bartender/server. The shrimp and grits r 2 die 4 and the pickles & chips r amazing. It ended with a hot aromatic towel. Thnx!!!
One of the best bourbon lists in Chicago. Awesome mint juleps. Great food. Fantastic service.
Pretty good. Plenty food
St. Louis Ribs, Mac n cheese and Brussels sprouts.
I hope you came hungry! I would recommend the BBQ flight appetizer to get a feel of the different meats. Then I would get the Kobe ribs... expensive, but the best meat I have ever had!!
Gorgeous outdoor heated seating
$15 prefix 3 course lunch menu....amazing
This turkey day, the upscale Gold Coast barbecue joint is whipping up a delectable smattering of sides such as pork sausage and apple stuffing, as well as candied fingerling sweet potatoes.
Yummy pulled pork sandwich!

Score brunch with a delicious down-home BBQ twist at this Downtown destination. Try the sweet potato pancakes smothered in pecan butter and bourbon maple syrup, or the Kobe brisket eggs Benedict (!!).
Try the BBQ Flight - hits the stop.
The benedict flight at brunch is amazing and great for people who can't make up their minds. All the meats are present.
Don't miss the bacon-cheddar hush puppies served with chipotle mayonnaise -- fried, bacon-y, salty goodness all in one bite.

venue.name: Piccolo Sogno

items.summary: Lots of people like this place

venue.description: Piccolo Sogno, which translates to “little dream” in Italian, is Tony Priolo and Ciro Longobardo’s dream Italian restaurant, featuring fresh, seasonal rustic Italian cusine and an all-Italian wine program. Join us today for an amazing experience!

items.text: Eat outside on the patio.
My favorite place for Italian. Chef Tony Priolo cooks seasonal rustic Italian food. The boys and I love to go for their thin-crusted pizzas. The restaurant has an amazing outdoor deck that transforms
You have to have the Brazino --incredible!
It sits on a corner of a very busy six-way intersection, but you'd never know it once you're ensconced in the backyard patio, shielded by tall fencing and surrounded by uplit landscaping.
Looking for a great outdoor space in the summer time and have a great meal at the same time?
One of the better italian restaurants in chicago. Definitely make it one a nice day and sit outside because it makes all the difference. Great service that makes you feel like italy!
Excellent service. Beautiful patio packed with people!
Patio is gorgeous!
Known for their outdoor patio, killer wine list (super hidden bargins) and black truffles!
Great food and one of the best outdoor areas in the city
You just have to sit outside to get the full experience, it's beautiful! Spaghetti Neri is the must try here.
Lobster risotto is excellent, as is the beef carpaccio appetizer.
One of Chicago's best outdoor dining patios
Our concierge Catherine at Sax Chicago says that when you're enjoying a long lunch in Piccolo Sogno's garden, it feels no different than relaxing in Tuscany.
Have the blueberry gelato.... Homemade and delish!!!!!!!!
The large plate of burrata (fresh mozzarella stuffed with cream) and culatello (a style of prosciutto) doused with olive oil is a treat worth returning for.
try the chickpea fries!
Order the stracci with asparagus, mushrooms and truffle oil. So delicious!
Cozy, lively, good for group of party of 2 dinners. Good food and service.
Romantic spot, especially outside. I had the best gnocchi ever here.

Check out liquor license no. 1 in the Bar!
Unlock the root beer special by checking in - photo of real beer, though looks the same
Best root beer ever!!
The Berghoff Cafe is in the lower level of the Berghoff Restaurant! Quick, casual, cafeteria-style dining.
The sauerbraten is excellent--lots of flavor! Get some red cabbage on the side.
Opened in 1898, The Berghoff serves German American fare, and is one of the oldest restaurants in the city.
The Berghoff is currently open during weekday lunch hours, or for private events.
best bar in chicago, still despite all attempts to remodel.
Great for lunch. They have a huge pretzel dish, and quality sandwich items with German sausages. I like the variety of bread served before the meal. Free root beer with check in!
Amazing Gluten-free options here. Everything that is available is clearly marked

The legendary, century-old German haunt has added a few modern dishes to the menu over recent years (bacon-wrapped shrimp, molasses-crusted salmon), but we stick with the way things were.
I have a hard time making decisions, so the beer sampler was just my style
The sausage trio is pretty good

items.text: Best thin-crust in the midwest (possibly the country.)
Rudy's Special is a monstrous concoction, topped with cheese, sausage, mushrooms, onions, and green peppers, takes up to 30 minutes to cook all the way through. Request in advance!
What can I say? It's hot, it's fresh, it's served in a downtown bar atmosphere and it's on State Street! It's awesome!
Best thin crust pizza in Chicago. (It's the crunchy, buttery, pastry-like crust.) Place your order w/the host while waiting for your table.
Their pizza is better than Gino's
Awesome staff, super friendly!
Rudy’s Special deep dish comes loaded with sausage, mushroom, onion and green pepper while Chad’s Special thin crust includes chunks of chicken with housemade barbecue sauce.
Forget Giordano's or any other "authentic Chicago" pizza place. Pizano's is the best. Hands down.
Best thin-crust pizza in the city.  Buttery, crispy, crunchy, flaky, and delicious.
Great thin crust piled high with extra toppings! Hands down my favorite
The butter-crust deep dish is great with a Guinness.
Make sure you're willing to wait 30-40 minutes for the deep dish. Better get an app while you wait.
Grab a deep dish pizza with sausage and peppers! Nom nom!
Great Italian wedding soup!
Best thin crust pizza anywhere. Can't visit Chicago without stopping. Call ahead for quicker pizza
Get the thin crust pizza!
This place is the tits.
Rudy Malnati Jr. and his mother—who still makes every ball of dough—carry on the tradition of Chicago-style pizza in this festive Gold Coast spot. The buttery deep-dish remains among Chicago’s best.
Thin crust pizza is unbelievable!  It's unlike anything I've ever had!!
I'm not normally a fan of deep dish, but WOW! Try the Rudy's Special. The mozzarella and sausage are magically delicious.

venue.name: Tavern on Rush

items.summary: Lots of people like this place

venue.description: Tavern On Rush is Chicago's place for steak and seafood. Tavern On Rush is an upscale, contemporary Chicago steakhouse which boasts an extensive menu.

items.text: Go to Tavern on Rush and have the Tomato Bisque.
This seems to be a very family oriented part of town. It looks like a lot of older gentlemen are driving their nieces around and taking them to lunch.
Tavern on Rush offers a classic steakhouse menu crafted by executive chef John Gatsos and a glitzy bar that serves up classic cocktails catering to discerning drinkers.
excellent food, service & people watching!
Bloodies are not good. Homemade chips good. Salmon BLT = yes.
Mocha Mud Pie
Great place, food and fun time with friends!
Always lively and fun, great food and perfect for people watching.
Amazing food. The sea food was amazing and the so is the beef.
Tavern on Rush!🌟🌟🌟🌟
One of the best Steakhouses in the city! Great food, good people watching, awesome location! Do the Filet Oscar and a Dirty Martini. #conciergetip
Tipsy pear martini...dangerous but so delicious
Visit Tom at the bar, he's the best!
Get the Hummus! It's the best I've ever had, anywhere! Lemon-Dill Hummus with crumbled feta cheese on top- served with carrots, celery, cucumbers and the best warm pita bread around!
Try the Salty Dog cocktail!  Refreshing!

Restaurants and Bars typically will never give you a hard time using Eluma inside their establishments. To be courteous though, always let an employee or manager know you're using Eluma before vaping.
For everyone who wants a nicer than average experience on Rush Street
For some peculiar reason Tavern management will not seat six at the same table on the sidewalk tables. So if you want to enjoy breakfast with a large group go elsewhere.
Try the Bloodys made by Lawrence & the Fillet Mignon Benedict
Went to Tavern on Rush and it was great. Good food, reasonable prices, excellent service. FANTASTIC Mocha Mud Pie (just so you know.)

venue.description: Welcome! The Boarding House opened December 2012 and is led by Proprietor and Master Sommelier Alpana Singh. Enjoy a curated and thoughtful list of 500 wines from around the world that will expertly complement your dining experience.

items.text: Great food, service and wine. Staff is extremely knowledgable about wine pairings.
Not your mom's pork chop. Unless your mom makes the best pork chop ever; on a cauliflower puree with butternut squash and pork belly. Honestly, when a pork chop is done right... you can't go wrong.
Nice people working at that joint but the food was overpriced and disappointing.  Go for cocktails, skip the resturant.

venue.description: A Chicago institution since 1977, Carson's is the place visited by presidents, America's favorite athletes, stars of TV, the big screen, and literally millions of BBQ devotees. formattedAddress: 1 S Dearborn St (btwn Madison St & Monroe St)

items.summary: Lots of people like this place

pageInfo.description: With authentic Italian cuisine, impressive wine selection, and rich local history, Rosebud Restaurants offer more than just a meal—they offer an experience.

items.text: Rosebud shows restraint with its simple inch-thick patty layered with two slightly charred slices of American cheese, lettuce, tomato and pickles, all bookended with a pretzel bun.
Top ten burgers in Chicago.
Try the Bacon Blue Cheese Burger
Awesome service, awesome food. The ribeye was fantastic, perfectly prepared and cooked. Amazing place. Really.
The beef tenderloin club is the bomb diggity!  Definitely recommend!
Steak salad impresses with a whole sliced skirt steak just off the grill, along with chopped greens, hearts of palm, cubed beets and other veggies underneath ($16).
Formal waitstaff first-class service but push the signature dishes (daily specials looked as good or better), and brag about "wet-aged meat" vs. "dry-aged meat." Incredibly good steakhouse.
I will remember their stakes for ever.
Food was good service was slow... Would not really recommend
You shouldn't come here and order anything but a steak.
I love the lobster roll with chips :)
Perfectly prepared.
Best steak I have ever had in my life.
The newest addition to the Chicagoland restaurant empire offers more of the same to its loyal biz-cas clientele: pricey, well-portioned steaks, chops and fish in a comfortable yet elegant atmosphere.
The wedge salad is amazing too!
Try the toasted jalapeño corn chowder for something different!
the mac and cheese is divine and enough for the whole table. Coconut shrimp was also a winner and they had surprisingly good salmon for a steakhouse.
The tuna sliders are amazing. You have to try that
The service here is impeccable.
Grab a seat at the bar with Mark! Fantastic service.

items.name: Great places to bring your mate to dine
Chicago's Best Burgers
items.description: You talk a big game, pretending to waver between the scallops and the veal. But you know what you really want: the burger. http://tmoutchi.us/YmTIHi

sample.text: ... ribeye was fantastic, perfectly prepared and cooked. Amazing place. Really.
